name: European Glyphosate Task Force 2
goal: The European Glyphosate Task Force 2 (GTF2) is a consortium of companies joining resources and efforts to renew the European approval of glyphosate with a joint submission. GTF2 was established in 2019 to seek the renewal of the EU authorisation of glyphosate in 2022.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Consumers, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Single market, Trade
euInitiatives:
GTF2 is established for the sole purpose of engaging in the regulatory process foreseen under Regulation (EC) No. 1107/2009, specifically relating to the renewal of the EU approval for the active substance glyphosate.

While policy and legislation such as Directive 2009/128/EC on the sustainable use of pesticides and the refit of Regulation (EU) No. 1107/2009 and Regulation (EU) No. 396/2005 are of relevance to GTF2 member companies, the scope of GTF2 activity is restricted to the EU regulatory process covering the assessment of glyphosate.
